body.head.byline: By BEN SISARIO; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

abstract.p: Next Wave Festival at Brooklyn Academy of Music will be biggest in festival's 24 years; performances noted; photo (S)

block.p: Music will be everywhere at the Next Wave Festival at the Brooklyn Academy of Music this fall. The 18-engagement festival -- the biggest in Next Wave's 24 years -- begins on Oct. 3 with choreography by Akram Khan and Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker, left, based on the music of Steve Reich, as part of the ''Steve Reich @ 70'' celebration, also at Lincoln Center and Carnegie Hall. It ends in December with ''Don Juan in Prague,'' an adaptation of Mozart's ''Don Giovanni'' by David Chambers that stars the Czech avant-garde singer Iva Bittova. Some of the events in between will be ''The End of Cinematics,'' the third part of Mikel Rouse's ''opera vérité'' trilogy, inspired by Susan Sontag's essays on film; a tribute to the Afro-pop legend Fela Kuti with Amadou and Mariam, Cheikh Lo, Les Nubians, Dead Prez and others; and Carl Hancock Rux's opera-oratorio ''Mycenaean.'' Other highlights include the choreographer Sarah Michelson's Brooklyn Academy debut, return engagements by Pina Bausch and the Japanese butoh troupe Sankai Juku, and the Chekhov International Theater Festival's production of ''Twelfth Night'' in Russian, with a cast of Russian film and television stars. Subscription tickets go on sale on June 19. Information: (718) 636-4100 or bam.org.
